revisionDesc.change: changed transcribed 'better here no' to 'better here now'
updated value of @target on final ptr
Replace internal notes with external notes
updated TEI header to follow new encoding of respStmt within titlStmt; moved notes to external notes file and replaced with ptr
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Added note on 1 May 1866 move to Pacific St.
Replace straight quotes with smart quotes

body.p:
it dont don't seem as if we had been here one whole month matt says one month of the twelve is gone i got your letter Walt yesterday with 3 dol dollars in all right and very glad to have it i suppose you are at mrs grasons Graysons yet how is the old lady i suppose she is as usuall usual or you would have written we all remain here yet and i suppose we shall for there dont don't seem to be any places and if there was i dont don't think i could undergo the mooving moving operations again i like it better here now we have got kind of stoed stowed away a little more if i had one more room but i might as well wish for a whole house so i will be content if i could only rest but that seems almost impossible the going up and down stairs tires me more than it ever did matty says it tires her too so i think they must be hard stairs the water is no where but in the basement and no way to get in the yard but down the basement i tell mat i shall be favorable
to water-closets after this) we pay 15 dollars a month about the worth of the whole house george has paid the rent he dont don't like it very well here its it's so far for him to come i dont don't know what his ideas are probably he will get married who its it's too we dont don't know but he appears to be very much taken with some one i said something to him about it the other day partly in joke and partly in earnest he said he dident didn't know but he should when he got time he has got to be very economicall economical very different from when he was in the army but every body changes some for the better and some for the worser)

Mr Davis is appointed chief engineer of the prospect park with a good salary i think now Jeff will build on his own lot a brick house) i feel better than i have felt only very lame otherwise i am much better Dr rugglesRuggles was here last sunday he goes to the country to vermont this week the children is extremely well mat has has very much to doo do she is going to have a girl to work give my best respects to mr and mrs OconorO'Connor and mrs mixMix
